clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Immunonutrition on Septic Complications After Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Immunonutrition on Septic Complications and Analytical Acute Phase Reactants After Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass

lead_sponsor.agency: Instituto de Investigación Sanitaria de la Fundación Jiménez Díaz

clinical_study.source: Instituto de Investigación Sanitaria de la Fundación Jiménez Díaz

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective randomized clinical trial of all the patients undergoing Roux - en-Y gastric bypass will be performed. Patients will be randomly assigned into 2 groups: those patients receiving a preoperative balanced energy high-protein formula (group 1) and those receiving preoperative Immunonutrition (group 2). Preoperative weight loss, postoperative septic complications and analytical acute phase reactants will be investigated.

detailed_description.textblock: A prospective randomized clinical trial of all the patients undergoing Roux - en-Y gastric bypass will be performed. Patients will be randomly assigned into 2 groups: those patients receiving a preoperative balanced energy high-protein formula (group 1) and those receiving preoperative Immunonutrition (group 2). Postoperative septic complications (anastomotic leak and organ/space SSI) and analytical acute phase reactants (white blood cell count and C reactive protein) will be investigated.

primary_outcome.description: Anastomotic leak and organ/space SSI determined during 30 days postoperatively

secondary_outcome.description: The elevation of C reactive protein and white blood cell count will be determined in a blood sample extracted 24 hours after surgery

arm_group.description: Patients receiving a preoperative balanced energy high-protein formula, enriched with Omega - 3 fatty acids (Immunonutrition formula)
Patients receiving a preoperative balanced energy high-protein formula, without including Omega - 3 fatty acids

intervention.description: Balanced high-protein formula enriched with Omega-3 fatty acids. 200 ml of formula every 8 hours during 10 days preoperatively
Balanced high-protein formula, without Omega-3 fatty acids. 200 ml of formula every 8 hours during 10 days preoperatively

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- body mass index (BMI)>40 kg/m2
- BMI>35 kg/m2 with the presence of comorbidities associated to obesity
- Patients undergoing Roux-en-Y gastric bypass as bariatric procedure
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing other bariatric techniques different than Roux-en-Y gastric bypass
- gastroesophageal reflux
- patients with uncontrolled psychiatric disorders
- active infections or malignancies
- any other concomitant pathology considered as a contraindication for bariatric surgery.
